title_sort: charles l. heyde to walt whitman, 12 march 1889
title: Charles L. Heyde to Walt Whitman, 12 March 1889
text: U.A WOODBURY PROP.Van Ness and American HotelsL.S. DREWH.N. CLARKMANAGERSBurlington Vermont.The Van Ness House has a Safety Hydraulic Passenger Elevator Fire Escape and the Grinnell Automatic SprinklerVan Ness HouseFine Views of the Lakes and Mountains from all parts of the HouseBurlington Vt.March 12 1889Bro Walt.Han is uneasy for a postal. She is getting on quite well—makes good bread—weather is cold, to night.I had quite a long conference to day with Revd I. J. Bliss, rectory Episcopal church—he expressed great sympathy for me; in my straitend circumstances, and placed a 5 dollar bill, in my hand, as he has done once before, this winter, which got me 1/2 ton of coal and provisionsI shall have better luck after a time.I am on the petite[petit] jury, commencing April 2 dollars per day. I would much rather paint, could I sell my pictures.Saw Mrs Tyler in street, to dayKindly I remain—Charles Charles L. Heyde to Walt Whitman, 12 March 1889
